description: This trap is sent as a result of a file operation status change.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::fileOperationStatusChanged NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity i 2 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperSrcFileNameOrURI s EXAMPLE1 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDestFileNameOrURI s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperFileType i 1 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperCommand i 1 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperResult i 1 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperMessage s EXAMPLE

description: A counting sequence number, used to identify the order of traps as well as detect gaps in a received trap sequence.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence

description: Description.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex

description: The severity level of the alert from Recovery to Critical
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity

description: This is a unique number which identifies the type of alert. It is an alternative to using the OID as a unique trap type identifier.
See detailed decription for NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::NetopAlertType.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType

description: This is the system data and time when the alert-causing event occurred.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime

description: This is an optional text message to provide additional details about the alert.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage

description: The name or URI of the source file involved in the last file operation.
May be empty if no souce was involved.
If the file was internally generated then the file name may be empty or
else set to some agreed name such as _internal_.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperSrcFileNameOrURI

description: The name or URI of the destination file involved in the last file operation.
May be empty if no destination was involved.
Desitination file is the one ultimately created, deleted, or modified.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDestFileNameOrURI

description: The type of file(s) involved in the last file operation. It is assumed that if two
files are involved they are of the same type. This should be true for all file
commands which are primitive save, load, etc.)
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperFileType

description: This object contains the code for the most recent file command
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperCommand

description: The result code of the last file operation.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperResult

description: The time the last file operation was performed or initiated.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDateTime

description: An optional message associated with the last file operation
usually empty unless there was an error.
variables.name: NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperMessage

description: This trap is sent as a result of a file operation status change.
The OID of this trap does not conform to RFC2576 v1/v2c
interoperability requirements and is deprecated. It should
be replaced with fileOperationStatusChanged trap.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::fileOperationStatusChangedPreV41 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSequence u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::eventIndex u 9999 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertSeverity i 0 NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertType s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-TRAPS-MIB::alertMessage s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperSrcFileNameOrURI s EXAMPLE2 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDestFileNameOrURI s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperFileType i 4 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperCommand i 8 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperResult i 2 NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperDateTime s EXAMPLE NETOPTICS-FILES-MIB::lastFileOperMessage s EXAMPLE
